messages.ssml: <speak><audio src="https://actions.google.com/sounds/v1/cartoon/wood_plank_flicks.ogg"></audio>In this "sandbox", you have a little freedom to create almost any code you want. Here's examples of instructions you can say: <break time="1s"/> Apple equals 1. <break time="1s"/> Repeat 3 times. <break time="1s"/> Say hi. <break time="1s"/> If banana equals fruit. <break time="1s"/> When you're done, say "run code", and I'll follow the instructions. <break time="1s"/> If you need this list again, just say "what's on the list"</speak>
messages.displayText:
In this "sandbox", you have a little freedom to create almost any code you want. Here's examples of instructions you can say:

* apple equals 1.
* repeat 3 times.
* say hi.
* if banana equals fruit.

When you're done, say "run code", and I'll follow the instructions.

If you need this list again, just say "what's on the list?"

messages.speech: You found one of the hidden features!
